required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening Plasma HER2 Amplication by Digital PCR in Advanced Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Trastuzumab and Pyrotinib
clinical_study.official_title: Screening Plasma HER2 Amplication by Digital PCR in Advanced Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Trastuzumab and Pyrotinib

brief_summary.textblock:
The hypothesis of this study is to discover the efficacy and safety of trastuzumab combined with pyrotinib in treating advanced breast cancer with HER2 positive, which is detected by digital PCR. It is a single-arm, multicenter phase II clinical study.
The purpose of this study is:
1. To explore the Response rate (RR) and progression-free survival(PFS) and safety of patients with recurrent metastatic breast cancer who received trastuzumab combined with pyrotinib in positive plasma HER2 amplification detected by digital PCR.
2. To explore the potential using of digital PCR in recurrent and metastatic breast cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is:
1. To explore the Response rate (RR) and progression-free survival(PFS) and safety of patients with recurrent metastatic breast cancer who received trastuzumab combined with pyrotinib in positive plasma HER2 amplification detected by digital PCR.
2. To explore the potential using of digital PCR in recurrent and metastatic breast cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year after the last patient enrolled
primary_outcome.description: The ORR will be defined as the proportion of patients in the Efficacy Evaluable patient Set who achieve complete response (CR) and partial response (PR)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 year after the last patient enrolled
secondary_outcome.description: PFS will be defined as the time from first dose of study drug until documentation of disease progression or death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and Severity of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: hematologic, hepatotoxicity, Incidence of hypertension, Incidence of proteinuria

intervention.description: Trastuzumab: 3-week dosing regimen, The initial load dose was 8 mg/kg. Pyrotinib: 400 mg orally once daily, take it continuously, every 21 days as a cycle. Use until intolerable toxicity or disease progression occurs.

overall_official.affiliation: Cancer Institute and Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences

responsible_party.investigator_title: Screening plasma HER2 amplication by Digital PCR in Advanced Breast Cancer Patients Treated With Trastuzumab and Pyrotinib.
